context_bundle.summary: Go module system with go.mod management, semantic versioning, private module access, and dependency management

onboarding.quick_start: go mod init github.com/user/project && go mod tidy && go get -u ./...
common_patterns: Initialize module: 'go mod init github.com/user/project' creates go.mod
Add dependency: 'go get github.com/pkg/errors@v0.9.1' for specific version
Update dependencies: 'go get -u ./...' for all, 'go get -u github.com/pkg/errors' for specific
Vendor: 'go mod vendor' to copy dependencies to vendor/ directory
Replace directive: 'replace github.com/old/pkg => github.com/new/pkg v1.0.0' in go.mod
Private modules: 'export GOPRIVATE=github.com/myorg/*' and configure git credentials
Workspace: 'go work init ./module1 ./module2' for multi-module development
Checksum verification: 'go mod verify' to check integrity of dependencies
known_errors: module not found: Run 'go mod tidy', check module path and version
checksum mismatch: Run 'go clean -modcache' and 'go mod download', verify go.sum
private repo access: Configure GOPRIVATE and git credentials, use SSH instead of HTTPS
version conflict: Check 'go mod graph', use 'go get package@version' to resolve
replace not working: Ensure replace directive before require, use absolute or relative path
workspace issues: Run 'go work sync' to synchronize workspace
